New Records: Nikola Jokic and Russell Westbrook became the first pair of teammates to record a triple-double in the same game twice in a single season.
Jokic and Westbrook are also the first to record a 25-point triple-double in the same regular-season game.
Key Match Events: Nikola Jokic finished with 35 points, 15 assists, and 12 rebounds for his NBA-leading 15th triple-double of the season in the Nuggets' 124-105 win over the Brooklyn Nets.
Russell Westbrook had 25 points, 11 rebounds, and 10 assists in the same game.
Post-Match Reflections: Nikola Jokic said, 'I'm just glad we're winning the games because that's more important than the stats.'
Russell Westbrook credited coach Michael Malone with giving him the freedom to play his game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Jokic had missed the previous two games with an illness before returning against the Nets.
Jokic got his 10th rebound after Westbrook blocked Keon Johnson's shot with 6:51 left.
Others: The game was played on January 11, 2025, which is relevant to the question.
